sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"取消，废除"之意
means: abolish ：正式用词，指彻底废除某种制度、规章或习俗。
cancel ：用法广泛，多指取消债务、合同、证书、比赛、旅行、计划或约会等。
repeal书面用词，指撤销立法机关通过的协议、法案或法律等。

sentence.Network_en: He wonders if the different influences might not cancel each other out.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在想，各种影响能不能相互抵消。

sentence.Network_en: He had to cancel some engagements because of tiredness.
sentence.Network_cn: 他太累了，不得不取消一些约会。

sentence.Network_en: The band was forced to cancel a string of live dates.
sentence.Network_cn: 乐队被迫取消了一系列的现场表演。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (the sense 'obliterate or delete writing by drawing or stamping lines across it'): from Old French canceller, from Latin cancellare, from cancelli 'crossbars'

entry.def: If you cancel something that has been arranged, you stop it from happening. If you cancel an order for goods or services, you tell the person or organization supplying them that you no longer wish to receive them.

example.ex: The Russian foreign minister yesterday cancelled his visit to Washington...
example.tran: 俄罗斯外交部长昨天取消了对华盛顿的访问。

example.ex: Many trains have been cancelled and a limited service is operating on other lines...
example.tran: 多趟列车被取消,其他线路上运行的班次也很有限。

entry.tran: 废除,废止(文件、保险单);免除(债务)
entry.def: If someone in authority cancels a document, an insurance policy, or a debt, they officially declare that it is no longer valid or no longer legally exists.

example.ex: He intends to try to leave the country, in spite of a government order cancelling his passport...
example.tran: 尽管政府已经下令吊销他的护照，他还是试图要离开该国。

example.ex: She learned her insurance had been canceled by Pacific Mutual Insurance Company...
example.tran: 她得知自己的保险已经被太平洋互助保险公司中止了。

entry.def: To cancel a stamp or a cheque means to mark it to show that it has already been used and cannot be used again.

example.ex: The new device can also cancel the check after the transaction is complete.
example.tran: 交易完成后,这种新设备也能注销支票。

means.word_mean: 1. a notation cancelling a previous sharp or flat
1. postpone indefinitely or annul something that was scheduled;

sentences.sentence: "His skills offset his opponent's superior strength"

means.word_mean: 3. declare null and void; make ineffective;

sentences.sentence: "Please delete my name from your list"

example.en: Bruno threatened to cancel Max's Christmas if Max didn't pay up.
example.zh: 布鲁诺威胁说，如果麦克斯不把钱全部还淸就送他上西天。

Sentence.sentence: Goldman Sachs, an investment bank, cancelled a conference in Las Vegas at the last minute and rebooked it in San Francisco, which cost more but sounded less fun.
Goldman Sachs, an investment bank, cancelled a conference in Las Vegas in order to avoid seeming wasteful
Why does the author plan to cancel his Facebook account?
Cancel the contract with the customer.
Cancel the trip to prepare for the test.

means.word_mean: 取消, 废除, 撤销, 终止;  撤销, 取消, 废除（具有法律效力的协议）

sentences.en: He cancelled his order for the goods.
We were all disappointed to learn that the picnic had been cancelled.
sentences.cn: 我们得知这次野餐已经取消, 都感到很失望。

sentences.en: The post office cancels the stamps on a letter.
sentences.cn: 邮局盖戳注销信件上的邮票。

sentences.en: He cancelled many unnecessary words in his manuscript.
sentences.cn: 他把原稿上许多多余的词删掉。

sentences.en: The whole passage could be cancelled.

jushi.english: The post office cancels the stamps on a letter.
jushi.chinese: 邮局盖戳注销信件上的邮票。

jushi.english: This will cancel your debt to me.
